page.title: 05Yarrows' Farms JD&RS
page.content: Mr. Yarrow started farming 48 years ago and he was born at{Low Fields.}His family have lived there 66 years and they bought{Low Close}in 1961.The farm house Low Fields is 250 years old and Low Close is 300 years old. Yarrows own the farms. Low Close is 25 hectares and Low Fields is 96 hectares. Their farm is mainly{arable. Yarrows don't employ any farm workers but four brothers farm in partnership. They grow four{crops}which are barley, wheat, oats and hay and keep beef cattle and hens. They stopped growing potatoes in 1970 and went out of milk in 1973. They built a grain store, a Dutch barn with a lean-to, an Atcost building and a cattle shed. They have twenty fields and grow mostly barley and they have taken 5 hedges out in the last five years because they used to be small fields.
